listitem.para: You can now use OpenStack API or the Dashboard to manage your own IaaS : http://192.168.0.1/horizon with demo / password credentials.
Edit the security group "Default" to allow ICMP and SSH.
In the Dashboard, go to "Instances and Images" for spawning a new VM.

Since Horizon does not manage L3 in Folsom release, we have to configure floating IP from Quantum CLI (using demo tenant). To do that, you need to get the ext_net ID and the port_id of your VM : quantum net-list quantum port-list
Now, we are going to create a floating-IP attached to the virtual port of our VM and routed to the external network : quantum floatingip-create --port_id port_id ext_net_id
That's it! You should be able to ping your VM using floating IP.
